bestBHT.bht: Blessed is that servant who disposes of the provisions of the house with great discretion and prudence, behaving as a good ruler and a faithful steward. God Himself pronounces him Wise, faithful, and happy. Yet, we see that he could fall and perish forever, despite being described as blessed and happy.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: 41-48. unto us or even to all?—us
the Twelve, or all this vast audience?
John Gill: Blessed is that servant...who disposes of the provisions of the house, in his hands, with great discretion and prudence.
Whom his Lord, when he cometh...shall find so doing; behaving as a good ruler, and as a wise and faithful steward.
Rules well, and discharges his trust with integrity...and disposes of the provisions of the house...with great discretion and prudence.
John Wesley: Happy is that servant — God himself pronounces him wise, faithful, happy! Yet we see, he might fall from all, and perish for ever.

bhtAttempts.bht: Blessed is that servant…who disposes of the provisions of the house, in his hands, with great discretion and prudence, behaving as a good ruler and a wise and faithful steward. This servant rules well, discharges his trust with integrity, and handles the provisions of the house wisely. God Himself pronounces him wise, faithful, and happy. However, it is important to note that despite being described as blessed and happy, this servant is capable of falling from all favor and perishing forever.
